definitions.definition: pieces of wood, metal, building materials, etc. that are left after something has been destroyed

examples.text: Emergency teams are still clearing the debris from the plane crash.
Several people were injured by flying debris in the explosion.
Police have spent the day sifting through the debris for clues.
She found a pair of children's shoes among the debris.
The tank exploded, scattering debris all over the field.

definitions.definition: rubbish or pieces of material that are left somewhere and are not wanted

examples.text: Clear away leaves and other garden debris from the pond.
Remember to clear the drain of debris regularly.
These worms feed on plant debris.

wordOrigin: early 18th cent.: from French débris, from obsolete débriser ‘break down’.
